column4: I need helping accessing my XP HD from Ubuntu, can anyone help me out?
I need to get stuff off my XP HD and put it on my Ubuntu one, but I'm not sure how
sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/<windows device and partition> /<mountpoint>
is that a code I have to use? cus I have yet to figure out most of Ubuntu
you have to use it from the terminal.  Applications > Acessories > Terminal
but you have to know the device and partition for your XP drive
its ntfs partition, not sure what you mean by device
i hate to say it, but you need to do a little bit of research on basic linux administration first.
yeah tell me about it, with work and school finding the time is hard though
this isn't exactly something that is easy to explain, if you don't really have any idea...
well I know alot about computers, but I'm not sure what you mean as device, its a WD250GB SATA drive
but in linux, every device is a file. so the physical representation of your drive is a file... such as /dev/hda represents the primary master PATA drive in your system
and /dev/hda1 would be the first partition of that device
